intro: Impatiens danguyana, commonly known as the "Whispering Beauty," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring striking, velvety leaves and clusters of bright orange or red tubular flowers. The plant is characterized by its unique, spurred petals that attract hummingbirds and other pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
